title: PACE: Proposal completion reports
description: 現在、コミュニティには、資金提供された提案の成功と結果を簡単に監査する方法がありません。

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is to provide a place for completion reports to be uploaded so the community can track when proposal are completed. Whilst this seems like a great idea, perhaps it would be better for a smaller proposal first just to deign and agree on what a completion report should be and whether Catalyst would mandate its production as part of the funding terms. Without this, the technical side would not be used.
f6_assessments.q1: The authors seem to have the experience available to complete the technical side of this proposal. However it cannot work without IOG/Catalyst agreeing to get funded proposal to produce it. Thus it feels like that should be a shorter project between now and the next fund to map this out, then proceed on the technical side if that is confirmed in another proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers when talking about success of this project are focusing on what would happen if funded projects submitted completion reports and the impact that would have. This is great, however success cannot happen without completion reports being mandated. More of the proposal should focus on how they will get this to happen, and on successful design of the reporting format. TO get a scalable efficient process, it would be good to have the completion reports in a standardized machine readable format so aggregate metrics can be published across projects, challenges etc to inform the design of future challenges and voters on who to fund. We don't want to continue funding types of projects or proposers who are not delivering successful outcomes.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal helps greatly with the closing with the loop of having a finalized report for the proposal upon completion of using their funds and the work that they finished.  This proposal would be scalable and applicable to all proposals
f6_assessments.q1: This team has successful fund 5 proposals as well as a couple of fund 6 proposals all in the same vein as this proposal.  Their strategic relationships with other groups working in this area would greatly be able to help make this proposal work.  The team may appear to have a lot on their plate with multiple proposals in this fund period contengency plans for who would be able to help out in the case other projects take up more time.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a basic framework for the roadmap, deliverables, and timeline.  A little bit more detail with features to be delivered at certain points would help to paint the entire picutre as well as providing basic contingencies if delays occur.

f6_assessments.q0:
-The proposer introduces a tool for completion reports, to share the final execution result to the community. The emphasis is placed on the completion, the finished work at the end life of the reviewed proposal. Thus, the community will be provided with option to review the impact the completed proposal had. This proposal implies that the tool provided will not work as an on-going, monitoring of the development of the funded proposals. Its purpose is to identify and record successful projects, and help guide the community to support same teams for the future proposals. 
-This proposal should build on data set of the proposers two previous funded proposals. The two previous proposals, are in development and final stage is expected in April 2022.
This proposal does not address the challenges objectives and I strongly disagree.
f6_assessments.q1:
-It is not possible to define if the proposal is likely to be successfully implemented or not. The implementation and success of the tool that is to be developed and deployed, depends on aforementioned completion of the two proposals from fund 5. These two previous fund proposals are up to now in development.
-The teams expertise is addressed as 15+ years of experience in web and mobile app development, 7 years of cloud infrastructure.
- The timetable and budget are determined on hourly basis with 6 weeks for completion. 
I disagree that this proposal will be successfully implemented in timely manner.
f6_assessments.q2:
-The roadmap is set in three stages for next 12 months, with proposed completion report near the 6 month mark. This roadmap depends on on-going projects from previous fund, these proposals are in development. With this in mind, it is difficult to define how success should be measured.
-Success metrics are declared as voter awareness of completion reports and how many people are looking at proposals with completion reports added. This metric is not clearly defined as there is no explanation how will the proposal achieve this information.
In summary, I rate the auditability with the score of 2.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement and solution presented are reasonable and within the scope of the challenge.

One of the essentials of auditability is to disseminate information about funded proposals to the community. The availability of completion reports allows reputation systems to be created and integrated as the proposed model is open source. This encourages collaborative work and avoids fragmentation of information between multiple sources, this data/information set has great potential to improve the auditability of funded proposals.

The goals and metrics mentioned indicate a positive impact on the items established in the challenge brief.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team described relevant experiences(including sources) for the development of the proposal, such as aptitude in web development (front end/back end) and has been actively participating in Catalyst for several months, having contributed with several projects related to community integration (voters, proposers and CAs). such as Catalist Swarm and  https://projectcatalyst.org/

There is description of a reasonable and well-structured plan, with a cohesive timeline;

A budget breakdown was included according to the allocation of time in different activities and the hourly rate. The established values are reasonable and compatible with the values corresponding to web development rates and other activities.
Considering the fact that the team split complementary proposals into 3 different proposals, it's not clear why the budget allocated for Hosting and Software is the same for all proposals ($500USD).
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity on the problem, solution and how they relate to the challenge.
Relevant metrics were included, but KPIs were not included. I would recommend only including KPIs for greater objectivity and to improve auditability.
The roadmap has relevant goals that allow easy auditing.

solution: 最終的な実行結果と達成された成功指標を共有するための完了報告のためのツールを提供し、それをコミュニティで共有する。
experience: ウェブ/モバイル開発の経験5年、戦略的コンサルティングの経験1年、ファンド5でCatalystに焦点を当てた提案に資金提供を受けた経験あり
